fields.description:
Please upload your session recording here. The file you upload must be a .wav, .mp3, .flac, or .wma file.

Please make sure that your file is named in alignment with the following protocol, including the use of a two-digit number format for all numbers:

Your Full Name - SC## SC First Name - Session ##

Here's an example of a correctly-formatted file name:

"Sally Smith - SC01 Jane - Session 03"

Thank you in advance for labeling your recordings in this way.
fields.allowedExtensions: wav, mp3, flac, wma, m4a, mp4

fields.label: HTML Block
Mentor Sessions Check-In
HTML Block
fields.content: In the LCCP you are allotted two hours of 1:1 training per month with your Mentor, to be divided up in whatever way supports your Mentor/Mentee relationship best. Please use the fields below as needed to log all 1:1 meetings that you had with your Mentor this month in service to this requirement. All Mentor hours must be complete in order to pass each Unit.

Date of Mentor Session #4 (if applicable)
Length of Mentor Session #4 (in Minutes) (if applicable)
Topics Discussed in Mentor Session #4 (if applicable)
HTML Block
Group Calls Check-In
HTML Block
fields.content:
LCCP Group Calls are considered to be an integral part of your Coach training. If you did not attend a Group Call live, it’s up to you to catch up on the replay, and to submit a Group Call Reflection Summary (accessible on your LCCP Center Dashboard) in line with the FLI Honor System. All Group Call Reflection Summaries for the month are due by the last day of the month.

Attending Group Calls live cancels out the Group Call Reflection Summary requirement. No further assignment is required when you are present and participating live on LCCP Group Calls.

fields.label: This Month's Mentor Group Call

HTML Block
fields.content: Please take some time to reflect back on your past month as a PC, as you move forward powerfully into your next.

fields.label: Briefly describe how your LCCP Support Team relationships (PP, PT, and BB) are currently supporting you:
How would you like to change your LCCP Support Team relationships moving forward?
What has been working for you within the PC Community?
What hasn’t been working for you within the PC Community?
What is one action you could take to co-create a positive outcome for any challenges you noted?
Anything else you would like to share with your Mentor and the Director at this time?
HTML Block
fields.content:
YES! You made it through a whole month in PC Land!

We know that this program is no easy feat. You might not even have fully known what you were getting yourself into. Yet here you are – facing the challenges, and taking steps forward in support of your heart’s calling! You are getting closer to becoming a CFLC with every step!

It is our honor to witness your growth, perseverance, and commitment – both to this process and to your own Fearlessness. Please press the button below to sign off on your work for this month.

Please note that a copy of your Monthly Self-Evaluation submission will be automatically emailed to you. You are strongly encouraged to keep files of all of your PC work, in service to documenting this transformational journey, as well as for future reference.

that I have now finished, it is my understanding that I am cleared and ready to take my Final Exams.

fields.description: Please list the names of all members of your Power Team who participated in this assignment. Please also note any members who did not participate.

fields.label: This Month's Scenario
fields.description: Please copy and paste this month's Coaching Scenario below as a frame of reference.

fields.label: #1 | GET CLEAR: Coaching to the PROBLEM
fields.description: What is the overt issue that the Client is presenting to you, asking for your support with, and/or wanting to solve? Aim to rephrase it in 10 words or less.

fields.label: #2 | LISTEN BEYOND THE WORDS: Coaching to the PROCESS
fields.description: Underneath the problem at hand, what might the work of this session really be about for this Client? Aim to phrase it in 5 words or less.

fields.label: #3 | CHOOSE YOUR GIFT: Supporting your Client
fields.description: If you could give your Client only one thing during this session, what do you sense would be the most important and impactful? Aim to phrase it in 1-3 words.

fields.label: It's time to write your Narrative Essay
fields.description:
Now that you've established some key broad points for your approach to this Scenario, please create a brief yet detailed narrative essay that generally shows how you would connect with this Client from a coaching perspective.

Do your best to write as if you were speaking directly to the Client, and remember that a well-written Scenario - like a well-coached session - will typically include at least 80% questions. As much as possible, avoid including responses from your Client. Instead, practice focusing on layering your own path of coaching questions.

Once you have written out your session, take some time to answer the questions that follow below. Please note that there may be some overlap in your essay and the answers to these questions. For the sake of this assignment, you may assume that an opening with Risk has already taken place.

fields.label: What FLI Tools could support this Scenario?
What homework would you assign to this Client?
fields.description: REMINDER: Make sure that this is apparent in your Narrative Essay above.

fields.label: As a Coach, what three specific questions would you definitely want to ask?
As a PC, do you have any specific questions about this Scenario that you’d like to address with your Mentor?
fields.description: If so, please include them here:

fields.label: CONGRATULATIONS!
fields.content:
When you have completed all sections of this assignment, please click the blue button below to submit your Monthly Coaching Scenario. As a reminder, Scenario assignments are always due on the last day of each month, just like your Monthly Self-Evaluations.

And here's another important reminder: Once you press SUBMIT, remember to CELEBRATE - since you are now officially one practice Scenario closer to your Written Final Exam at the end of the LCCP!

CONGRATULATIONS, FEARLESS ONE!
Keep taking those steps forward...you are getting there!

fields.content:
THE RATINGS AND WHAT THEY MEAN:
1 - None or Almost None
No indication of knowing, embodying, and/or utilizing the tool, skill, or principle can be readily observed
2 - Starting to Emerge
Some indication of knowing and/or embodying the tool, skill, or principle can be observed on occasion, though with little-to-no indication of being able to utilize it independently; may show up when Mentor prompts
3 - Basic Passing Level of What's Required
A rudimentary ability to utilize the tool, skill, or principle independently can sometimes be observed; usage may still be slow, infrequent, inconsistent, unrefined, and/or awkward in its application
4 - Above Passing Level
Demonstration of the tool, skill, or principle is starting to become more fluid, and an increase in understanding is tentatively appearing; the tool, skill, or principle is being utilized a bit more frequently and consistently, though not yet as regularly or effectively as desired
5 - Advanced for a Beginning Coach
The intersection of deeper understanding and able application has been reached; the tool, skill, or principle is being utilized fluidly in sessions most of the time, and a level of basic beginner proficiency with it has been achieved

YES! You made it through a whole month in PC Land!

We know that this program is no easy feat. You might not even have fully known what you were getting yourself into. Yet here you are – facing the challenges, and taking steps forward in support of your heart’s calling! You are getting closer to becoming a CFLC with every step!

It is our honor to witness your growth, perseverance, and commitment – both to this process and to your own Fearlessness. Please press the "SUBMIT" button below to sign off on your work for this month.

Please note that a copy of your Monthly Self-Evaluation submission will be automatically emailed to you. You may also choose to take screenshots and/or phone photos of your work as a back-up. You are strongly encouraged to keep files of all of your PC work, in service to documenting this transformational journey, as well as for future reference.

fields.label: HTML Block
fields.content: Below is a condensed list of all major requirements that you have been working on since beginning the LCCP. These items must all be complete prior to taking either of your Final Exams. Use this document as a personal checklist as you are moving towards graduation. This form is a PC support tool, and must also be emailed during the Certification Period to FLICertifications@FearlessLiving.org with a cc to your Mentor.

fields.label: Your Name
Email
Mentor's Name
Study Clients (SCs) and Fearless Book Groups (FBGs)
fields.content: Study Clients (SCs) and Fearless Book Groups (FBGs)

fields.label: Attended FCW, or completed the equivalent requirement via private mentoring
Completed 12 Sessions (minimum) with your first SC
Completed 12 Session Summaries (minimum) with your first SC
Submitted finished “Session 12B” Coaching Template to your Mentor
Worked with 5 different SCs (minimum) to date
Completed the full Fearless Living book arc with 3 different SCs (minimum)
Completed 4 consecutive sessions (minimum) of your first FBG, with at least 3 participants present for each session
Completed and submitted FBG Outline, Roster, Summary, and Evaluations to your Mentor
Completed 75 Coaching Hours (minimum), with 20% permitted from groups
Submitted finished SC Log to your Mentor
Mentor Sessions and Group Calls
fields.content: Mentor Sessions and Group Calls

fields.label: Completed at least one hour of 1:1 mentoring per LCCP month, during each of 9 months (minimum) (9 hours minimum), and submitted Mentor Prep Forms prior to each session
Attended one Mentor Group Call during each of 9 months (minimum), or listened to recordings and completed Reflection Summaries as needed (9 Calls and/or Summaries minimum)
Attended one PC Community Call during each of 9 months (minimum), or listened to recordings and completed Reflection Summaries as needed (9 Calls and/or Summaries minimum)
Other Assorted LCCP Assignment
fields.content: Other Assorted LCCP Assignment

fields.label: Moved through all required Unit material in the LCCP Center, took notes, and finished quizzes
Submitted Monthly Self-Evaluations at the end of each of 8 months (minimum) (8 Evals minimum)
Submitted Monthly Scenario Assignments at the end of each of 5 months (minimum) (2 group + 3 individual Scenarios minimum)
Completed DTM in 12 consecutive weeks; submitted DTM Self-Evaluation Form
Completed 1:1 SC Review Session with Rhonda in Unit 6 or 7; submitted Follow-Up Form
Completed 3 Sample Sessions (minimum) with other coaches; submitted Follow-Up Form for each
Submitted Final Questionnaire
Submitted Final Presentation Outline
Please use this space for any notes that pertain to any of the items above:

In alignment with the ethics of the FLI Honor System, I confirm that all information contained within this

document regarding the completion of my LCCP requirements is factual, honest, and truthful; and

represents only the most freedom-based version of myself. I confirm that all of my LCCP Requirements

included on this form are complete, or otherwise noted and approved. Therefore, based upon the work

that I have now finished, it is my understanding that I am cleared and ready to take my Final Exams.

fields.description:
NOTE : If your audio is not accepting you may upload it to dropbox and leave us the link here.

If you are unsure of how to upload to dropbox follow this link for instructions on uploading and sharing.

 https://help.dropbox.com/files-folders/share/add-files

fields.label: Number of FBG Members Who Are Enrolled In This Group
Number of FBG Members Who Attended This Session
Full Names of Session Attendees
HTML Block

This type of submission will log Coaching Hours only, and will not count as a full Session Summary. In the LCCP, you are required to submit a minimum of 12 full Session Summaries in working through your first full FL book arc with your first Study Client. Please consult your Mentor with any questions.
HTML Block
Reflection Questions
